column2: Document Title: CHK-012-CIV-SSB-RSS Walls-Precast Panel installation
ITP Description: SSB RSS Walls - Panel installation
ITP approved for use by: Victor Mira
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Plan position shown on the drawings at the base of the wall shall not exceed ±15mm (refer to drawings for WP locations)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Mark number of strips per row on the back of each panel.
○ Mark design locatoin (Wall number, row and column) as per elevation drawings on the back of each panel
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: RSS Panels are to be installed as per IFC Drawings and specified schedule.
– Check the 19mm nominal gap to be maintained
– Check the 1 in 40 slope is to be maintained
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: 20mm nominal gap between panels and Abutment wall is to be maintained
○ Where nominated 125mm wide x 6mm thk hot dipped Galvanized plates fixed to abutment wall OR 250x6 Galvanised Folded Plate as per IFC drawings.
○ 600mm wide BITAC tape installed on the joint
○ Galvanised Plate, installed with M16x75mm long Gr.4.6/S
○ For the slip joint location, spcing between panels to be min 25mm.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Install Filter Fabric against all vertical and horizontal joints
FREQUENCY: Each course of panel installation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Install 300mm wide vertical strip drain -at every vertical joint between panels in RSS wall.
○ Ensure no gap is formed between strip drain and RSS panels.
○ Strip Drain to be encapsulated by non-woven geotextile with minimum width of 500mm in accordance with VR 682
FREQUENCY: Each course of panel installation

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: To ensure compliance with the tolerances specified in clause 682.20, the Contractor shall install stable and permanent survey reference points on a not more than 5 m (horizontal) by 2 m (vertical) grid covering the whole face of the RSS
FREQUENCY: Each course of panel installation
8. Traceability of precast units and records
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Unique ID of precast panel is recorded.
– ATTACH: marked-up elevation drawings or installation record with reference to panel ID
VERIFYING DOCUMENTS: Attached marked-up drawing or installation record
REFERENCE: IFC Drawings VR 682.06, VR 682.17, VR 682.20

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The level and alignment of each course of facing panels shall be checked progressively after placement of each course and prior to placement of the next course to ensure compliance with the dimensional and positional tolerances stated in the design. The Contractor shall record the results of this checking together with details of any non-conformances and the associated corrective actions
– Relative displacement of adjoining smooth panel faces shall not exceed ±15mm measured normal to face of the wall
– Local deviation of the wall face at any location with a 3m straight edge, shall not exceed 15mm
– Variation in gap width between facing panels shall not exceed 5mm per meter length and 10mm over the full lenght of the gap
– The wall level shall not deviate from the specified level by more than ±20mm
– The tolerance of position measured at the top of the wall face shall not excedd 5mm per 1m of wall height
– The verticality of the RSS wall facing shall lean backward at a minimum slope of 1(H) in 40 (V)
FREQUENCY: Each course of panel installation

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
